title: Editable website name (document title) + documentation note

requirements.summary: Change the browser tab/page title by updating the HTML document <title> in frontend/index.html to a clearly editable app name string.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/index.html` contains the updated `<title>...</title>` value (replacing the current "Valentine's Interactive Website").
After rebuilding, the browser tab title shows the updated name.

file_operations.description: Replace the current <title>Valentine's Interactive Website</title> with a clearly editable app name string (e.g., "Valentine Interactive"). Ensure the <title> remains in English and is the only change needed to affect the browser tab title on rebuild.

requirements.summary: Add developer-facing documentation describing exactly where to change the website name (document title) in this repo, including frontend/index.html and any runtime title-setting location if introduced later.
acceptanceCriteria: A new or updated documentation file in the repository clearly lists the file path(s) and the exact line/element to edit to change the website name.
Instructions are written in English and are unambiguous (a developer can follow them without guessing).

file_operations.description: Create a short developer note titled something like "Changing the website name (browser tab title)" that explicitly points to `frontend/index.html` and the `<head><title>...</title></head>` element as the place to edit. Also include a note stating that the current codebase does not set `document.title` at runtime, and if a runtime title setter is added in the future, document the exact file/location (e.g., a React effect) alongside the HTML title so developers know which source of truth to update.
